docs.snippet: Hanley Ramirez homered twice as Los Angeles beat Arizona and won its division for the first time since 2009, and John Lackey led Boston past Baltimore for the Red Sox’ first playoff berth since 2009....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hanley Ramirez homered twice as Los Angeles beat Arizona and won its division for the first time since 2009, and John Lackey led Boston past Baltimore for the Red Sox’ first playoff berth since 2009.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Los Angeles Dodgers beat Arizona Diamondbacks, 7-6, and win their division for first time since 2009; Boston Red Sox defeat Baltimore Orioles, 3-1, to clinch their postseason berth; other scores noted.

headline.main: Dodgers Wrap Up N.L. West Title; Red Sox Clinch Spot

docs.snippet: If the Mets’ season ended Friday, they would wind up fourth in the National League East for the fifth straight season, a franchise record for consecutive finishes in the same spot....
docs.lead_paragraph: If the Mets’ season ended Friday, they would wind up fourth in the National League East for the fifth straight season, a franchise record for consecutive finishes in the same spot.
docs.abstract: New York Mets could wind up fourth in National League East for fifth straight season; it would be a franchise record, dubious as it might seem, for consecutive finishes in the same spot.

headline.main: For Mets, Another Year at the Same Address

docs.abstract: San Francisco Giants defeat New York Mets, 2-1.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees needed a win to keep up the momentum after an emotional victory Wednesday night, but instead they endured a loss to the last-place Blue Jays on Thursday.
docs.abstract: Toronto Blue Jays defeat New York Yankees, 6-2, dimming Yankees chance to make the playoffs.

docs.snippet: John Sterling’s baritone bombast, mistakes, creative home run calls and unalloyed joy at Yankees victories have made him an odd but solid part of the Yankees brand....
docs.lead_paragraph: John Sterling’s baritone bombast, mistakes, creative home run calls and unalloyed joy at Yankees victories have made him an odd but solid part of the Yankees brand.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column holds that radio announcer John Sterling’s baritone bombast, mistakes, creative home run calls and unalloyed joy at New York Yankees victories have made him an odd but solid part of the Yankees brand; singular, divisive, much-debated personality, Sterling seems likely to move with Yankees radio rights in 2014 from WCBS-AM to WFAN

docs.abstract: Hiroshi Yamauchi, who transformed his great-grandfather's Japanese playing-card company Nintendo into a global video game powerhouse, dies at age 85.
